posts.post_content:
People are thinking too small. This is obviously a combo card. Who the hell would you play this card in a mono white lifegain deck!?  
  
Think people! What about a deck that **wants** your cards to hit the graveyard? Evoke? Maybe combine with black recursion? Things that die on their own like [Aven Rif\*\*\*cher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aven Rif***cher)? This could give you infinite life if you have a way of getting infinite mana. Maybe combo with [Sanguine Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanguine Bond)? This triggers life gain effects like [Ajani's Pridemate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani's Pridemate). You could get some nice lifegain with [Boon Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boon Reflection)s as well.  
  
I dunno. Maybe I'm overrating this card. I just hate it when people dismiss cards like these as "crap" or "useless" without considering all the shinanegans that they could pull. I'm sure that this lifegain spell has some hidden advantage that other lifegain spells do not. I'm positive that this is another hidden gem that is waiting to be polished.  
  
While it doesn't look ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Gavrilo (10/15/2010 12:11:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Just imagining this in a control deck filled with cheap mana producers, or even tokens. I guess that after a few turns, you could be gaining 8-10 life a turn... not bad for casual/multiplayer game. But then second thought arose - its hard to win games when you spend all your mana not to lose.  
Bad card indeed. Put the ability onto a 2/2 cleric for WW and we have a decent card.

posts.post_content:
@majinara: My 1/1 Myr dies and I have no instants and 5 mana open. Proper Burial gives me 1 life, and this gives me 5. 1 is SMALLER than 5. This is better in decks with instants, but I'd usually take this instead.  
  
If you've got mana open, it's a great place to put it. 3.5/5
